website_summaries.verdict: If you are looking for a model that is extremely lightweight and portable, this may be the best choice for you.
pros: Comfortable inflated V pattern contours to the body
Requires 15 to 20 breaths to inflate, and firmness is adjustable
cons: The inflatable design is prone to punctures
Heavier campers may find that it doesn't provide enough padding for optimal comfort on hard surfaces

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: I'm 6'4", 350lbs and it (surprisingly) works well for me. See pics. It feels rugged enough, I blew it up in 8 strong breaths, and rolled it up easily on the first try putting it back in the carrying sack. On another note, my 5'5 160lbs girlfriend (see pics) fit better yet her hips touched through it while mine did not and we're both side sleepers. I'm guessing all my extra weight pushed the air from my upper half to my hips and provided more cushion. Works for me! I'm choosing it for a 2 week hike after painfully sleeping on the ground.
customer_reviews.author: Dad of 8

customer_reviews.title: Caution, does not stay inflated
customer_reviews.text: We bought 4 of these for our children as birthday presents for camping this year. On the first trip, two of them stopped holding air by the end of the second night, and the kids sleep on the floor. On the second trip the other two stopped holding air. We checked when we got home. All 4 are leaking from the nozzle. Basically, we threw away 120+ dollars on these poor quality air pads and the kids slept on floor.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Lauer

customer_reviews.title: inflated just fine when I took it out to make sure it ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in December, inflated just fine when I took it out to make sure it didn’t leak. But this past weekend I finally actually took it camping, and the darn thing won’t hold air for more than 5 minutes. I have no idea where it can be leaking from. And to top it off, I missed the return deadline by a couple days. If you buy, definitely sleep on it overnight, and test it right away to make sure it’s not defective.
customer_reviews.author: Gare

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't last
customer_reviews.text: It lost its ability to hold air after the second night of use. Then the plastic valve broke off.
customer_reviews.author: David  W McLoda

customer_reviews.title: Garbage!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is complete garbage, every since I bought this thing, it has done nothing but slowly leak. It will not even make it an 2 hours with someone laying on it before it declares and you end up on the floor. I have tried many times to look for the leak but I can’t find it. The quality controls of this company is complete trash obviously. I will never buy from them again.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: TERRIBLE NIGHT'S SLEEP
customer_reviews.text: The second time using this sleeping pad the valve stopped working AT ONE AM! Of course needless to say it was a horrible experience tossing, turning, blowing the thing up again only to be flat again an hour later. SAVE YOURSELF SOME MONEY AND BUY SOMETHING BETTER! I WILL RECONSIDER IF THE COMPANY STEPS UP AND REPLACES.
customer_reviews.author: Rafael Lima

customer_reviews.title: The ribbed 'V' pattern is a great design, and keeps you from sliding off if ...
customer_reviews.text: Packs very small and light, about the size and weight of a can of soda. It inflates FAST compared to most air mattresses (I did it in less than a minute, in about a dozen big breaths). The ribbed 'V' pattern is a great design, and keeps you from sliding off if you're on a slight incline (this is a BIG plus). The fabric feels pretty durable and I had no problems laying it on bare ground. It stayed at full pressure through the night... no waking up to add air. It deflates just as fast as it deploys. All in all, this was a great purchase, and has become a permanent addition to my pack.
customer_reviews.author: M40

customer_reviews.title: Potentially a Very Nice Product: If Only It Would Hold Air!
customer_reviews.text: The product is nice in appearance and when I first laid down on it, very comfortable. It took less than 20 blows to fully inflate. However, the pad was completely flat by morning. The process was repeated the next night. Since I purchased this product two months before I went on a camping trip, I was past the amazon return deadline. I have gone through the vendor's website for a repair, but they are very slow, and offer up a list of caveats (excuses not to cover under warranty). I shall be purchasing another pad (definitely not a Klymit brand) in order to have a pad for my next camping trip.
customer_reviews.author: kold_one

customer_reviews.title: This has to be the worst pad I've ever used.
customer_reviews.text: This think is awful. My whole body feels like sleeping on the ground. Every pressure point hurts and causes me to flop around all night with little sleep. Don't buy this. You would have a better time on a pool float.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Would not hold air
customer_reviews.text: I bought this sleeping pad for my husband in August. He needed it for a hunting trip September 22nd-30th. The first night he used it he noticed it wouldn't hold air. He had to wake up each night 3 times to refill it. We were really counting on this being a good sleeping pad for his trip. The return cut off date was September 23rd and he did not have cell service so now we are stuck with it. We are disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Crews

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING! I have been sleeping on layered comforters when ...
customer_reviews.text: AMAZING! I have been sleeping on layered comforters when camping for years. They are so heavy and always end up damp from humidity. There was no way I was purchasing an actual air mattress. I'm not the kind of person to show up to a weekend of "roughing it" with a queen size mattress. I was expecting this to be uncomfortable when I saw how small it actually is, but after 4 days of sleeping on it, I will never be without one again while camping. Worth the money no question.
customer_reviews.author: Justin W.

customer_reviews.title: Slow leak, unreparable
customer_reviews.text: Just used for the first time a couple weeks ago and it has a leak so slow we cant find it but yet you wake up and its completely deflated. Can't return as I bought it back in Sept to get prepared early for our June trip that we took and like I said it looks ok when you initially blow it up because it's such a slow leak. Its unrepairable since it's so slow also and now we are out that money. Our week long backpack trip was very miserable without a working sleep mat. Next time I will purchase a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Jusvic

customer_reviews.title: The repair kits are garbage!
customer_reviews.text: I thought these pads were great. . . until I had to repair a tiny pinhole leak. The repair kit provided by Klymit is extremely difficult to use. I searched fruitlessly for instructions on their website, and finally had to contact customer support. They directed me to a video that shows a supposed "expert" applying a patch to a klymit pad. Even on the video, the end result looks horrible with glue strewn about. I thought I might have better luck, but no - the repair kit didn't work well for me either. I've patched leaks in several Therm-a-Rest pads and their repair kits work flawlessly. Why would Klymit provide repair kits that are such a pain to use??
customer_reviews.author: MelanieDN

customer_reviews.title: Not comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I really tried to like this sleeping pad, but I'm not happy with it at all. I'm a 5'4" woman 135lbs so thought it would be perfect for me but it's not comfortable when I move around or even try to sleep on my side. I've used it a few times to give it a chance and now it's past the return period so I have to spend more money to find a new comfortable sleeping pad. Plus it takes forever to get all the air out.
customer_reviews.author: Angie L.

customer_reviews.title: Great design, fine shape
customer_reviews.text: Great design, fine shape, lovely weight to it BUT when used a disappointment inasmuch as it gradually deflates during the night so that come morning it is half-inflated, ergo half-useful. I tried screwing in the inflation nozzle well and truly. This made no difference. Lee Engdahl.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: I have a bunch of these for my family. We don't camp a ton, but more often use them when we go out of town and visit someone who doesn't have extra beds for us to sleep on. They are lightweight, roll up relatively small, and get the job done. Super easy to inflate and deflate. We used to take more ordinary (and cheap) air mattresses, which required also taking a small bellows pump to fill them. This is soooooo much better than that! Highly recommend, especially with Klymit's warranty on these.
customer_reviews.author: Christy H.

customer_reviews.title: Light, comfortable, and warm enough for 2.5-3 seasons
customer_reviews.text: Fairly lightweight and very comfortable. Very hard to beat, and almost in its own class at about $40. The deep baffles allow one's sleeping bag to expand, and provide some extra warmth. They also reduce pressure points for side sleepers, and reduce weight. Warmth hasn't been an issue, but if it were below 35°F or so I'd probably bring my Therm-a-rest foam pad for extra heat retention, just in case. The external material on the Recon edition is nice and sturdy, and feels like it will be very durable.
customer_reviews.author: M. Night Shyam-alien

customer_reviews.title: not durable
customer_reviews.text: finally used it and it kept deflating. Tried to identify the hole to no avail. The valve was shut and still kept flattening on me every night. Was in the field and just decided to toss it.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, reasonably light but really noisy!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a North Cascades section hike on the PCT. Great pad in every regard except it is incredibly noisy. Every movement of a nylon sleeping bag on this pad was loud enough to bother hikers sleeping a tent or two away. You expect some noise from any air mattress/sleeping pad but this far exceeds anything I've experienced with the dozen or so different camping pads I've used. Might be something that diminishes with time but I'll give it away rather than wait to find out.
customer_reviews.author: J. Maurer

customer_reviews.title: So good I bought more
customer_reviews.text: This is the 3rd Klymit sleeping pad I've bought! I also have the XL version of this pad and liked it so much we got this one for our son. This pad is pretty easy to inflate. It takes a few more breaths for me to inflate because I'm smaller in size. Its really comfortable and is even good for side sleeping. The best part is its size when its rolled up. Light weight and fits easily into a pack or bag. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: OLIVIA MCKINSEY

customer_reviews.title: Worked great until leak developed.
customer_reviews.text: The product was initially great. Feels good, easy to inflate/deflate, packable, etc.. but mine has already developed a leak after only a few uses. I'm hoping it was a defect and not all of their products are like this. I would love to buy another one, but I don't know if I'm willing to take another risk.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Company ignored me!  never replaced my leaky pad
customer_reviews.text: so I bought 2, one works but the other leaks at the blowing valve. contacted company and everyone was nice and say they will replace it pronto. When it came to the final step of sending me the return shipment then all communion stopped. I tried two more times but they stayed silent. I do not recommemend this overpriced pad with zero warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Quang Tran

customer_reviews.title: Light and Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Very light and small in size when packed, yet worked great at keeping me functional on a backpacking trip in spite of a bad back. I purchased it to replace the closed cell foam pad I have been using for many years, but which now makes me non-functional for a few hours after rising and with poor sleep quality... Aging sucks. Have not pushed it on the warmth factor yet - so far only 40 degree nights, so no feedback on that. Overall I am very pleased with the comfort and the packability of this mattress. If it ends up sucking in the cold, I will update.
customer_reviews.author: Sheridan

customer_reviews.title: Amazing pad! Lightweight and comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: This is a truly amazing product! It is so lightweight and comfortable. The v-shaped baffling of the air really works! I've had Thermarest, Cabela's own brand of sleeping pads, which was the heaviest and worst pad because it developed air bubbles very quickly, but this Klymit is the best. I didn't expect it to be so comfortable. My main consideration was size and weight as I am packing panniers and cycling 3,000 miles so I was surprised! I shoved it in my sleeping bag and this is the ticket. The material is not bad on the skin. Buy the best; lightweight and comfortable. Hope it holds up. Didn't come with a patch kit.
customer_reviews.author: L. Cooperman

customer_reviews.title: waste of
customer_reviews.text: deflated after 2nd night of camping.....could not find hole...waste of money
customer_reviews.author: Renee

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: This is pretty good when I use it in field environments. My last one unfortunately would deflate after a night's sleep so I had to replace. Wish the bottom could be reinforced a tad bit, but it would come at a added weight cost. Width could be better for this one and length is alright for someone around 70" tall.
customer_reviews.author: Ranger TS

customer_reviews.title: Great Pad, Super Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I recently used this pad for two weeks sleeping in the back of a HMMWV. This thing was wonderful. I slept like a baby every night (so well that once or twice the other trucks rolled out without me noticing). It packs up nice and small and is easy to pull out and set up. It doesn't take a whole lot to inflate it, but still enough that you might get a bit light headed if you try to blow it up too quickly. Overall, this is a great sleeping pad. Would absolutely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Onoku

customer_reviews.title: ITEM LEAKED - SLEPT ON GROUND FOR 3 NGHTS AS A RESULT
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these pads, one from Amazon and one from another retailer. Although the pads are better than most for a side sleeper when they stay inflated, my wife's pad went flat within 30 minutes of blowing it up. As a result she had a miserable time on a backpacking trip sleeping directly on the ground. I had to convince her to go camping, so this was a catastrophe in terms of getting her to go again. If you do buy it, sleep on it before you head out. There is no padding if it leaks air.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Great lightweight alternative for backpackers.
customer_reviews.text: Took this backpacking last weekend, and immediately fell in love with it. It weighs a fraction of my Thermarest pad, is nearly as comfortable, and was suprisingly warm. Several of the other backpackers on the trip (some with far more expensive pads) were so impressed with it that they were going to pick one up from Amazon this week too! When it comes to balancing price vs. comfort vs. weight, this may be the best option for backpackers today! Note: I wasn't compensated by anybody for this review. I bought this with my own hard earned cash, and am giving my own hard earned opinions.
customer_reviews.author: Brian209

customer_reviews.title: Happy With It
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent pad. Very comfortable. It's about 19 oz. where you can get some under 12 oz., but I think it's worth the extra weight for durability and comfort. Also, it's very quiet. Some pads make an incredible amount of noise when you shift around. Also, this pad is a great value at half the price of many other pads of similar quality. I wanted to give it five stars, but the valve, though it works, is a little tricky to understand. It seems I have to struggle with it each time and I'm always afraid I'll break it.
customer_reviews.author: David W. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, lightweight pad that needs some care
customer_reviews.text: This pad takes quite a bit of huffing and puffing to inflate (maybe 10 or 11 breaths) but is surprisingly comfortable. The material seems very light and fragile but I've been careful so far (2 uses) and no punctures. It packs down very small and works well both on the tent floor, a cot, or in the sleeve of a double-layer hammock. The valve seems to stick out much farther than needed and the "lock" is kind of a silly feature. I'm afraid this is going to lead to some future damage but only time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: John Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Compact, comfortable, and easy!
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect! I am the princess and the pea (this seems to be my single area of being incredibly picky! ). I sleep on a tempur-pedic at home, so even a hotel stay has me waking up with really sore shoulders and hips to turn over for relief about 8-10 times in a night. With this on top of the hotel bed, I only woke up a few times, so that's quite an improvement! Wish me luck for taking it camping with the family soon! Haha!
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey

customer_reviews.title: Great Night Sleeping Pad
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these for my son & his girlfriend. They took these on a camping trip they went on, with a large group of friends for 3 days and loved them. They said they were the only ones in mornings that were not complaining of back pain. They decided to keep their secret of a good night sleep to themselves, Lol They also ready loved that its lightweight, compact, on very easy to inflate.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable mat that blows up in about 15-17 breaths
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable mat that blows up in about 15-17 breaths. No pressure points at all. I slept on this while on concrete at 30 F in just a bivy sack and summer sleeping bag and had no cold issues at all penetrating it. I like the channeled design as it blows up faster than just an open vacuum type of mat. It is lightweight and folds up into a very small mass inside its' included bag. Very impressed with this product.
customer_reviews.author: KiwiandaussieinusTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Very cool indeed
customer_reviews.text: I gasled for air when two of these pads arrived in the mail after I opened the box. These things are super light co pared to the self onflating pads I am used to and pack smaller than a lightweight rain jacket. No more hanging it off the outside out your bag. They do take a little bit to fill up. They have held up well to use, making sure the ground is clear of anything that could puncture them. They are very comfortable dor there size and weight. They do help insulate against thermal heat loss with the ground. Perfect for big out, lightweight camping, hammock pad, etc. Other brands used many many thermarest
customer_reviews.author: Appalachian GunSlinger

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, light weight, and packs small
customer_reviews.text: I don't know how this would deal with cold ground, but using it for a few camping trips and for crashing on the floor during the holidays, this has been great. I have an older Thermarest which is supposed to self-inflate, but I find this easier to use since you'd need to blow in the other to get it fully inflated, too.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Ashton

customer_reviews.title: Slept great on this mattress!
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable! Easy to inflate and deflate. I tried 3 other camp pads and this one beat them all by miles. Didn't loose any air over several nights. Design of the chambers makes it so I can sleep on my side, back and stomach without any pain. I am 5'11" 220 pounds and this is plenty long enough and by keeping it slightly under inflated, along with the chamber design, I can sleep on my side, back and stomach without any soreness all night long. If you plan on sleeping on your side I highly recommend a thick pillow. I used a pack sack with my clothes stuffed in it.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Martin

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, Good for Backpacking
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for the camping trip my husband and I were taking to Havasupai. I used it for two nights and it worked like a charm to offer a little more comfort than the ground. It is narrow, but if you're tucked inside your sleeping bag, it won't make a difference because your arms are kept closer to you anyway, instead of hanging off the sides of the air mattress. It was a lot less bulky to carry than the one my husband brought, so that was a definite bonus in packing for our trip.
customer_reviews.author: Chmeliar

customer_reviews.title: Great nights sleep
customer_reviews.text: I just used this for the first time this past weekend in the mountains. It's light, and I am not. At a husky 250 lbs, it kept me off the ground just fine, was wide enough to fit all my gloriousness on, and it didn't slip around too much. I was sleeping on an incline, but it only moved because I tend to do all of my exercise while I sleep.. great purchase!! Note: no one gave me anything free for this review, but it would be cool if they did... just sayin.....
customer_reviews.author: Blue

customer_reviews.title: This is a great alternative to more expensive pads
customer_reviews.text: This is a great alternative to more expensive pads. It's about the same weight as the more expensive ones, and even more comfortable than a more expensive one I bought. I got them for backpacking. I haven't put too much use into the two I bought yet, but they seem fairly durable. The only thing I question is the nozzle. It works really well for blowing it up and getting the air out- no problem there- but I do wonder if the pad will rip near the nozzle first, since it sticks out quite a bit. If it does, patching it will be hard. This is about the only advantage that the foam types have over the air-filled ones.
customer_reviews.author: Abe S.

customer_reviews.title: No pressure points! Sooo small & light!
customer_reviews.text: What a weight off my shoulders! Literally!!! I’ve been lugging a named brand self-inflating foam sleeping pad around the woods waaaay too long! I just didn’t think anything without foam could prevent me from waking up stiff and sore. Until I tried this! I can even lay on my side and my hip doesn’t create a pressure point. I’m impressed! And I’ve lightened my pack!
customer_reviews.author: Anne Catherine Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Just Pull Up a Rock
customer_reviews.text: Purchased four of these for our family. They were lightweight and easy to inflate. They are narrow, but that’s to be expected for something so lightweight and packable, I suppose. Of the four of them, only one remained airtight without leaking. If you enjoy sleeping on rocks, give this a try. If you’d prefer to stay a little more comfortable, look for a different pad. Entirely unimpressed with this product. Also, because the product can “contain gas” it is not eligible for return to Amazon, so buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn C.

customer_reviews.title: Durable sleeping pad
customer_reviews.text: This is my summer pad in Texas heat. It provided sufficient loft on roots to sleep. The color is a slight gripe, as I typically like something that stands out, The 70D material insures strength and durability. Ok It fit my medium build as well as my wider (and heavier) friend on different occasions. I don't roll, but my friend does. He disliked the raised baffles, but that was all that super him from trampling me in the night. So, good job baffles!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Francis

customer_reviews.title: Good value. Happy enough.
customer_reviews.text: Had this for a couple years. This is the third different brand pad I’ve bought, and my favorite. Wish I had gotten the Luxe for a little more width and wish there was a little more insulation value, but it’s small, light, easy to use, and holds air. Hard to complain too much.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel R. Hansen

customer_reviews.title: Better than my actual mattress.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this after reading the great reviews. Thank you to everyone who reviewed this before, I sleep better on this over a hardwood floor than my actual bed. They engineered the pattern of inflated bumps just right to support my back. I typically sleep on my side and this works great for that, simply amazing feet of engineering for human comfort. It's easy and light to travel packaging makes this the best for hiking with camping, but it's also so perfect I leave it my car so I always have a mat in case I end up stuck somewhere without an extra bed.
customer_reviews.author: chris kovar

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't make noise!
customer_reviews.text: I like how easy it is to blow the mattress up and it easy to keep it blown up. It also doesn't make that crinkly noise when I moved around on it and it was pretty comfy, especially for the size that it can be when put away. I camped with it in a remote place and it was pretty cold. It helped keep me off the ground and warmer than just laying on the tent bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Van Wert

customer_reviews.title: Deflating not good
customer_reviews.text: While this is light weight, easy to inflate, and comfortable deflating this is the most annoying thing in the world. The air somehow gets trapped inside when you roll it up, putting this away is a nightmare.
customer_reviews.author: conner

customer_reviews.title: Side-Sleepers Savior
customer_reviews.text: This is the best sub-$100 sleeping pad I've ever used. As a side sleeper, I was extremely happy with the comfort and support. Not the warmest pad in the world, but it will do well for most 3-season hikers. Rolls up nice and small too, barely bigger than a soda can. It does take quite a few deep breaths to fill it up, but the valve system is super easy to use and allows you to take your time if you want.
customer_reviews.author: Jarrod Moore

customer_reviews.title: This sleeping pad was super lightweight and packable - a little bigger ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing is clutch! I recently used this for a camping trip to the catskills in NY. This sleeping pad was super lightweight and packable - a little bigger than a 12 oz soda can. It only took about 12 breaths to complete inflate. I felt comfortable (and warm) throughout the night. I weight about 260, so sleeping directly on the ground gets uncomfortable, but I found myself quite comfortable on the Klymit Static V on my back and sides. Very quick and easy to deflate and repack. Would purchase again. Update: after my second use, the cap got jammed shut while I was uninflating and cracked... klymit, u send me a new one plz?
customer_reviews.author: William Z.

customer_reviews.title: comfortable but noisy
customer_reviews.text: light weight, easy to inflate and durable- our 95 lb lab walked all over it and it survived. I weigh approx 220 and did not have one contact point with the ground for the 3 nights that I used it. My only down side which cost it a star is that it is very noisy when ever I rolled over or moved. It sounded like I was sleeping on plastic shopping bags! Maybe that will go away, I will update on my next trip coming up.
customer_reviews.author: Scot

customer_reviews.title: Saved my back and shoulders!
customer_reviews.text: This pad makes the ground feel less like dirt and rock and more like an actual mattress. You have to make sure you inflate the pad with as much air as possible (which isn't incredibly hard, just have to close the valve right when you can't blow any more air in), but once complete, the pad works wonders. I no longer wake up with back or shoulder pain when I use this while camping.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for military
customer_reviews.text: I use this product on all my field ops (over 250 nights worth so far). I bring this instead of the standard issue Iso Mat and I am so glad I did. I have not used it with cold weather, but I imagine it would still work well. It rolls up nice and tight with the supplied storage bag and takes 60 seconds to inflate-- less if you want to pass out from blowing air too quickly. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Cole

customer_reviews.title: Warning: Not Made For The Infantry!
customer_reviews.text: I am a Ssgt in the Marine Corps Infantry. Second field op out in the desert this thing was done for. Micro cuts every on the bottom led to me waking up on a flat mat. Keep in mind that I had it on top of an iso mat. If you are going camping with the family and are sleeping in a tent, this would be a great product to buy. For the men and women who are serving their country and sleeping out in the dirt........ This product is not for you. Spend your money on something of better quality.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly great product for such a small package
customer_reviews.text: My husband is over 200 lbs and was very skeptical about using this product. After inflating it and using it, he vary pleasantly surprised. For such a small package, it provided a great sleep. No sinking in the middle, no valley formed, no waking up your partner (if using the double one) with every toss and turn. Another benefit...you don't have to be a rocket scientist to deflate it, roll it up, and fit it back into the bag it comes in. It is very easy and convenient to use.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie M

customer_reviews.title: Great portable, quick-inflating mattress
customer_reviews.text: I love this mattress! It is lightweight and packs into a small bag and I can inflate it quickly with about 10 puffs (no need to use an air pump). It is more comfortable to sleep on than heavier self-inflating mattresses I have used. This summer, I attended a 12-day camp where I had to sleep on a bed with a thin mattress on top of wires that I could feel right through the mattress. I put the air mattress on top and slept comfortably every night. I did need to add a little air to the mattress each evening before going to sleep, but just one or two puffs and it was back up to pressure.
customer_reviews.author: JS

customer_reviews.title: Very thin material
customer_reviews.text: I don't like to write reviews after using something one time, but I've used this mat a handful of times now and I have to say, the material is very very thin. I've used it maybe 5 times and it has been comfortable and great, I've only used it in a tent and I already have a tiny hole in it. Luckily it comes with a patch kit but if only using it in a tent and it got a hole, I can't imagine using this on any surface that isn't completely smooth. Kind of a bummer because this wasn't cheap...
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: but I slept better than any other camping trip I have ever been ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these mats and was hesitant. I was 5 months pregnant and didn't want to fight with an air mattress for 4 days so we purchased cots and these pads. I am a side sleeper and was positive that I was going to be uncomfortable regardless, but I slept better than any other camping trip I have ever been on. My husband was also comfortable and we had no complaints. They held air and set up and break down where easy. They store well and are very durable.
customer_reviews.author: Jessie

customer_reviews.title: Durable and comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this primarily for car camping and weekend overnight hikes, and have used it all summer and into fall. It works great; very comfortable, inflates easily, and packs up small without too much forcing. Was using this recently on a weekend when the temperature came down to 25 degrees at night, and the insulation was impressive; I was the most well-rested of my group the next day! My only complaint is that it's a little long for my preference; I'm 5'3" and there's an extra 12-13 inches that I could do without, especially when sleeping in small tents. I wish they offered it in different lengths! Otherwise, great product.
customer_reviews.author: historybuff87

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: 15 deep breaths to inflate this. It keeps me off the ground when I'm lying down - even on my side - but as I reposition or sit up, I do hit the ground. Doesn't seem too noisy to roll around on. Weighs more than my Z Rest closed cell pad, but takes up a lot less space in my pack.
customer_reviews.author: Kaprkorn

customer_reviews.title: 2nd Time Buying
customer_reviews.text: This is so comfortable that I bought this tan one for my friend on his birthday. I use this for backpacking as well as car camping. I have slept on it in the bed of my truck when I didn’t feel like setting a tent up. Lightweight, not very big when deflated and in the stuff sack. Overall I love this pad.
customer_reviews.author: Chris J.Top Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: My teenage sons (age 14 and 16) took this on a 2 week/100 mile backpacking trip this past summer. We purchased this because they needed sleeping pads, but because they are only 90 and 110 pounds and would be packing it for 2 weeks, they needed something very lightweight and that didn't take up too much space. We needed something that didn't cost us an arm and a leg. This was a great buy! We bought 2 in different colors. Since then, my husband and my 20 year old son have used them on camping trips and they both gave it great reviews as well.
customer_reviews.author: AZmom

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised!
customer_reviews.text: I have not tried sleeping on this yet, but I am surprised how comfortable it seems to be. I tried it at home and it really feels good to my body considering how minimal and lightweight it is. My wife also tried it and she was very surprised how comfortable it felt to her. Now, that is the acid test. If she likes it, it must be pretty good! If it holds up to camping conditions then I will be well satisfied. But so far, I'm very happy with my choice. (For what it is worth I am 60 years old with some typical aches and pains in joints and muscles, etc. Bought to use on bicycle tours )
customer_reviews.author: Christopher W. Burke

customer_reviews.title: A good night sleep.
customer_reviews.text: Really easy to inflate and deflate. Really easy to get it back into the bag when you are done. I feel like everytime I put it away, I get it just as good as the manufactuerer did. Slept comfortably on it. I had it on top of a cot for extra padding. I did try it on the ground for a minute and I think we would have been okay overnight on it.
customer_reviews.author: J. J.

customer_reviews.title: Used this for military training and slept like a KING every other night
customer_reviews.text: THIS IS INCREDIBLE. Used this for military training and slept like a KING every other night. lol Real tough, held the air and really comfortable no matter what you are laying on. I used it for 3 1/2 weeks straight and it helped me get through my training with little back problems from sleeping on the ground! Screw the puss pad and use this beast. A fraction of the size and 15 breaths to blow up. WORTH EVERY CENT.
customer_reviews.author: g.boyd

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for sleeping when camping. I like to sleep in a really soft support bed. I've used this pad once so far. I blew it up to the max air it could hold and it gave my hips really good support. Now if I can just get enough pillow support for my legs and head, I'll be just right. I am 5'5", 155 lbs.
customer_reviews.author: CK

customer_reviews.title: Not so great if youre a side sleeper or heavier person
customer_reviews.text: Not so great if youre a side sleeper or heavier person. I only weigh 250 and when I would lay on my side, Id bottom out. It did hold air throughout the night but wasn't as much as I had put in the night prior.
customer_reviews.author: TaxationIsTheft

customer_reviews.title: Nice mat
customer_reviews.text: This thing is pretty awesome. I am 6'3" and weigh 280lbs. No deflation and I don't wake up touching the ground, so that's a first. Don't expect it to come close to an actual mattress, but it beats the heck out of sleeping on the ground. The channels in it also make it a little difficult to roll up again, as air ends up trapped everywhere. Well worth the money overall.
customer_reviews.author: 7e3zndo6x1m9

customer_reviews.title: Rolls up to original size no problems
customer_reviews.text: This product performed as advertised which was very surprising these days. Opened package and inflated (night time setting) without any problems. Provided excellent cushion with no deflation overnight for several nights. At pack up deflated easily and resumed original size which was a worry as I was tight on space. Excellent buy and worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Tucsonian

customer_reviews.title: not wide enough for a male adult 6'2
customer_reviews.text: my shoulders dont fit on this air bed, and my arms hang off of it witch causes my sholders to hurt when i get up, i was hoping for a better fit then the self air blow up bed i gotten before, painfully short. this one seems to be not much more def.. it feels like its ment for a small women or a teen... sad for how pricey this bed is
customer_reviews.author: Erik

customer_reviews.title: Air sleeping pad good nite sleep.
customer_reviews.text: Pros= 1. easy to inflate 2. X tube design prevents air from swith in tubes as weight is applied 3. Never felt any rock or other ground issue picking me in the night. 4. Compact and lite weight. 5. Initial deflating good when plug removed. CONS= 1. Air trapped in x designed air tube as it is rolled to place in storage sleeve. NEVER found the correct folding that permitted air to escape as it was rolled up. Thusly I would have to unroll and roll again twice or more to get it completely compacted.
customer_reviews.author: David F.

customer_reviews.title: A great inflatable sleeping pad for camping
customer_reviews.text: This is a great price for a sleeping pad. I have yet to use it more than one night, but last night was a dream. The ridges take some getting used to, but otherwise this is a steal for the construction/price.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good
customer_reviews.text: I've used this pad for camping three times so far. It is comfortable and very light. Had some difficulty figuring out the inflation valve in the dark the first time I used it; read the instructions before you're actually camping.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Rutherford

customer_reviews.title: LIghtweight and sturdy...perfect for a long hike
customer_reviews.text: Took this pad up to South Kootenai Lake in Montana. Ten miles and 3000 vertical feet later (about 8 hours of non stop incline) and i was beat and ready to roll out the sleeping pad. Super easy to figure out and i was fast asleep for an afternoon nap in under 10 minutes. Lightweight, comfortable, and fit me perfectly. 6'1 and 225 lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Goodwin

customer_reviews.title: Great for camping/traveling
customer_reviews.text: Kept me surprisingly comfy. It’s a bit narrow I wish I would have gone with their wider option they offer but I’m still happy. It’s super light easy to roll back up and store. Easy to inflate I was able to sleep comfortably on my back and stomach no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Roost

customer_reviews.title: Good enough for sleeping in a car
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for sleeping in my car, Tesla Model 3. Not better or not worse than its price. And also wanted to see how Treasure Truck looks.
customer_reviews.author: TS

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: Fits nicely in my single and double hammock and compact enough to take with me in my pack. Placed sandbags on top totaling 400lbs over the span of 72 hours to test it and no deflation at all. Thick enough to stop rough edges rocks and small twigs from puncturing as well. Minimal to no “rubber squeaking” and was a good night sleep at 50 degrees Great product!
customer_reviews.author: HK_MarineActual

customer_reviews.title: Great for my scout who needs lightweight
customer_reviews.text: Great for my scout who needs lightweight, packable pad. Provides more padding and far better comfort than our self inflating pads, and it packs down to about the size of a nalgene bottle so it fits well in backpack. It inflates quickly with a few breaths. Fills easier than waiting on self inlaying pad, and it is much easier to deflate and refold/roll up. Got it on a lightning deal as I probably wouldn't have sprung for regular price. Now, after seeing it I am watching for price drop for another or two.
customer_reviews.author: ThriftyMom

customer_reviews.title: Works well and folds up small - great value
customer_reviews.text: Used it once so far and can report that it works well. Folds up small and is a decent size, fitting my 5'-8" length. Keeps you off the ground with an insulation of air. I made the mistake of blowing it up to the maximum (about 25 breaths) and kept rolling off the pad during the night. Next time I will reduce the pressure inside so that it is just enough to cup my body while still providing the required insulating cushion over the ground. No so sure about the efficacy of the market-hype ridged design.
customer_reviews.author: Grumpy Goat

customer_reviews.title: Great sleeping pad!
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic sleeping pad. It packs up nicely and blows up easily. Still haven't found the best method to get all the air out yet due to the baffling method. But it is very comfortable and lightweight. I would not consider this if I were an ultralight ounce snob, but if I am sleeping on the ground, I will carry this with me no matter what. Update: My valve fell out after less than 2 years of occasional use. I used it maybe 12 times max.
customer_reviews.author: Ven

customer_reviews.title: Not the sleeping pad for me
customer_reviews.text: The pad is lightweight which is nice, but after thirty blows into it I still didn’t have it even halfway inflated which is not what it said in the description when I purchased it. It only seemed comfortable when I was sleeping on my side, couldn’t sleep on my back as it was super uncomfortable. Would also spend extra to get a wider pad, this one is pretty narrow and I kept coming off of the pad during the night.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Belt

customer_reviews.title: Great for side sleepers!
customer_reviews.text: Just slept on it last night to give it a try. I'm a side sleeper, so it is hard to find a pad that is comfortable for camping. Woke up feeling refreshed and great! It is plenty comfy and my shoulder and hip were doing just fine. The only con is the air valve when you are blowing it up. It is a bit awkward as it does not have any sort of valve to prevent the air from flowing out the last bit of inflating.
customer_reviews.author: justin

customer_reviews.title: Blows up quickly, comfortable
customer_reviews.text: They are right. This blows up in 10 breaths from this little old lady. Haven't used it yet as our Caribbean trip got canceled, although I did lay on it in the house and it felt comfortable. I bought it for the beach to put on my lounge chair. It seems to fold fine for that purpose even though someone else said it didn't. It fold up nicely for travel also.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy and comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to blow up, easy to pack away, comfortable to sleep on. So happy we had this on our recent camping trip. We also used this as our "beds" when we moved out of house, instead of a typical air mattress, and it was good enough for us. It's worked well for me who's 5'2" and 110 lbs. and my husband who is 5'10" and 165 lbs; we're both 30 years old and semi-athletic with no health issues. In fact, it was even comfy enough for me to sleep on while 3-4 months pregnant.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Used it for a music festival and worked great
customer_reviews.text: I used this for a 5-day music festival (where are my Forest friends?!) and I've never had to blow air into it after the initial inflation. Worked great, and my friends all want to buy one now. Great purchase. I don't care about the color (camouflage) because it was on sale. Just makes it invisible!!! (kidding)
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Light weight but hard to sleep on
customer_reviews.text: I purchased it over a month ago and first used it last weekend, it is very light and easy to inflate, however, it was very difficult for me to get a good position to sleep on during the night. Of course it passed my return period, sigh!
customer_reviews.author: Rose City

customer_reviews.title: Seems supportive enough
customer_reviews.text: I'm pushing 50 and my lungs are not as good as they were 30 years go so it took me 40 blows to fill it up to my desired firmness. I lied on it on my living room and I don't feel the floor and as a side sleeper that's kinda important for me to remain comfortable. I will keep it inflated over the next few days to make sure that it's not leaking air. I'm excited to field test it when I next go camping and I will update my review if any issues come up
customer_reviews.author: eyeland

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded my expectations.
customer_reviews.text: No regrets here. I used this on top of a cot on when tent camping in Iceland. It makes the world of a difference keeping your bag and body away from the cold ground and acts as an insulator as well. I have used thermarest pads in the past and find the klymit to provide better insulation, is more comfortable and far more portable. Great product. If I were not using a cot and had room for it I would probably use this on top of a thermarest pad for both comfort and insulation reasons.
customer_reviews.author: James H

customer_reviews.title: My Favorite Sleeping Mat
customer_reviews.text: I love this product period. I am a side sleeper and I can sleep on my side on this comfortably! It's so easy to inflate and its so compact. The quality is good though I'll admit I haven't really abused it much. However I wouldn't hesitate to get another one because that's how great I've slept on it.
customer_reviews.author: Rudy Ruelas

customer_reviews.title: Comfy sleep
customer_reviews.text: Very very comfortable, little on the heavy side, but packable - inflates pretty quick, deflates ok, nice colors, exactly as pictured and described - price is high but I have a crummy back and I sleep nice on this - cover it with a sleeping bag liner and you got a summer sleep system
customer_reviews.author: ruski3:16

customer_reviews.title: It's fairly easy to blow up
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had the chance to try this camping yet, but warm weather is coming soon! It's fairly easy to blow up, very lightweight, and compacts down real small. I will be using it for boundary waters and other backcountry camping trips this summer and I can't wait! Trying it at home, I could not feel the ground when laying on it. I'm a side sleeper, so this is important for my shoulders and hips which ache and keep me awake all night if I don't have sufficient padding. I'm hoping this will improve my sleep and thus improve my camping experiences :)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Portable
customer_reviews.text: Portable and comfortable enough for padding of this size. It would be nice if it has an electric pump or something similar so I don't have to blow it up myself every time.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Lee

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding!
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. I’ve been sleeping on issued isomats and my back would kill me anytime we are in the field. This thing is quick to set up and is extremely comfortable, my back has never felt so good in the field. Takes no time to deflate and pack. The weight is minimal and takes up very little room so no issues adding it to my pack.
customer_reviews.author: Corey Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, warm, and high quality material.
customer_reviews.text: These are comfortable and very easy to use. Takes about 15 seconds to inflate and stays full of air all night long. It comes with a patch kit but after about a dozen uses its thick, resilient material doesn't seem weakened at all. Packs up into a small bag and takes up very little room in your pack. Great purchase and my friends are consistently jealous when I pull mine out on backpacking trips.
customer_reviews.author: K. Trowbridge

customer_reviews.title: Both were leaking air by 2nd night
customer_reviews.text: Bough 2 of these Both were leaking air by the second night, had to keep waking up to reinflate
customer_reviews.author: Ali

customer_reviews.title: Small and comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: For it's size surprisingly comfortable. Only complaint it takes more breaths then I thought to completely inflate. Not as comfortable sleeping on your side however much better then being on the bare ground.
customer_reviews.author: G300

customer_reviews.title: 3mm tarp
customer_reviews.text: Stayed in packaging until first campout....went flat after an hour of being laid on...test upon arrival before window for returns are closed
customer_reviews.author: Turbo99

customer_reviews.title: It packs super small. We even kinda floated on it in ...
customer_reviews.text: I took this on a 7 day backpacking trip and after the first day my girlfriend took it from me because her pad was so uncomfortable. I let her use it begrudgingly because I slept so well on that first day. Oh well. I just need to get another so we both have them. It packs super small. We even kinda floated on it in a lake. Great purchase. Oh, and I'm a side sleeper, I'm about 185 lbs and my hips and shoulders never touched ground.
customer_reviews.author: Philip

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable and durable. I've used it in the field many times & it's still holding up. Inflates really quick, but deflation is kind of tedious. Packs down relatively well. I kinda wish it was a bit bigger for sleeping on my side. I always wake up halfway off the mat.
customer_reviews.author: Brendyn

customer_reviews.title: Klymit's gear is fantastic. This is super comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Klymit's gear is fantastic. This is super comfortable, durable and (most importantly) compact. Took my three day bag down to a 35L pack, and probably shaved a full pound off my previous load. Maybe the single most significant upgrade I made from my old backpacking gear. I liked it so much I got a second one for my girlfriend.
customer_reviews.author: Brad A.

customer_reviews.title: Thin, but makes a world of difference.
customer_reviews.text: I'm only 5'8 at about 140 lbs, so buyer be aware. I took this camping for a few trips and I'm glad I did. It's compact, inflates quickly, durable and keeps my spine in line when I sleep. It was a worthy investment and I feel bad for my friends that are sleeping on the ground when I use it. I'm not surprised when I'm the one who's bright eyed in the AM.
customer_reviews.author: Dominic D

product_meta.title: Klymit Static V Lightweight Sleeping Pad
product_meta.description: Rugged and comfortable, lightweight and versatile, the Static V is an ideal pad for avid backpackers and casual campers looking for performance at an entry-level price. The body-mapped V chamber design limits air movement to help maintain insulating performance and ergonomic comfort, dynamic side rails cradle you on the pad, and the rugged material is great if you want to sleep on the ground under the stars. The Static V quickly inflates in just 10-15 breaths, packs up small, and weighs only 18 ounces.
feature_bullets: Sleep comfortably all night: Affordable lightweight camping pad with v chamber design to limit air movement and heat loss for better support and comfort
Easy to use push valve allows for quick inflation and deflation
Incredibly lightweight: Packed Weight: 18. 6 ounces; Packed Size: 3 x 8 inches; Made of durable and rugged 75D polyester fabric
Inflated size: 72 x 23 x 2. 5 inches; 10 15 breaths
Includes: stuff sack, patch kit and because we are authorized sellers of this product, it includes a limited lifetime
